translator disclaimer


Harvard Papers in Botany 15(2):353-414. 2010
https://doi.org/10.3100/025.015.0216

The Genus Campylocentrum (Orchidaceae: Angraecinae) in Costa Rica: A Revision

Diego Bogarín


Diego Bogarín

Franco Pupulin


franco.pupulin@ucr.ac.cr
Franco Pupulin

© President and Fellows of Harvard College, 2010.

[+] Author & Article Info

Author Affiliations

Diego Bogarín

Jardín Botánico Lankester, Universidad de Costa Rica. P.O. Box 302–7050 Cartago, Costa Rica, A.C. Centro de Investigación en Orquídeas de los Andes “Ángel Andreetta,” Universidad Alfredo Pérez Guerrero, Ecuador.

Franco Pupulin

Jardín Botánico Lankester, Universidad de Costa Rica. P.O. Box 302–7050 Cartago, Costa Rica, A.C.

Author for correspondence: franco.pupulin@ucr.ac.cr

Copyright & Usage

© President and Fellows of Harvard College, 2010.

Abstract.

A taxonomic revision of Campylocentrum (Orchidaceae) in Costa Rica is presented. The taxonomic history of the genus and its phylogenetic position are discussed. Characters of vegetative and floral morphology are treated, and their taxonomic significance is discussed. The genus is treated as comprising nine species in the country, and a key to species is provided. Each taxon is described on the basis of Costa Rican material, illustrated in a composite plate, and its distribution within the country is assessed. Distribution maps for all the taxa are given. Overall distribution, derivation of name, notes on species ecology, and diagnostic features are presented for each taxon. The names C. parvulum Schltr. and C. multiflorum Schltr. are neotypified. A new species from Costa Rica, C. generalense, is described and illustrated.

Resumen:

Se presenta una revisión taxonómica de Campylocentrum (Orchidaceae) en Costa Rica. Se discuten la historia taxonómica del género y su posición filogenética. Se tratan caracteres de morfología floral y vegetativa, y se discute su significado taxonómico. El género comprende nueve especies en el país, y se proporciona una clave de especies. Se describe cada taxon con base en material costarricense, se ilustra en una lámina, y se evalúa su distribución en el país. Se presentan mapas de distribución para todos los taxa. Para cada taxon se presenta la distribución, la derivación de nombre, notas sobre ecología de especies y rasgos diagnósticos. Se neotipifican los nombres C. parvulum Schltr. y C. multiflorum Schltr. Se describe e ilustra una nueva especie de Costa Rica, C. generalense.

Keywords: Orchidaceae, Angraecinae, Campylocentrum, C. generalense, Costa Rica

The scientific services of Costa Rican Ministry of Environment, Energy and Telecommunications (MINAET) and its National System of Conservation Areas (SINAC) for issuing the collecting permits under which wild species were collected. The curators and staff at AMES, BM, CR, INB, K, SEL, USJ and W herbaria for granting access to the collections and for the facilities provided. The staff of Kew Library for the facilities with critical literature and documentation. We are indebted to Robert L. Dressier for his interest and continuous support during all the steps of the present work. We thank the staff of LBG for helping in vouchering specimens and data management of living material. Jorge Warner, Director of LBG, for supporting our research activities. To Jorge “Coqui” Cambronero, Jorge Carmona, Robert L. Dressier, Melania Fernández, Reynaldo Gómez, Hilda León-Páez, Adam Karremans, Carlos Ossenbach, Allan Prendas, Ana Cristina Rodríguez and Rafael Trejos for helping during fieldwork activities and for provide useful data and material. Walter Maríin and Estela Sandoval kindly helped with the anatomy research. James Ackerman, Barbara Carlsward and Alec Pridgeon for their useful comments on the manuscript. We are particularly indebted with the Vicerrectoría de Investigación (Vicepresidency o Research) of the University of Costa Rica for all the economic and logistic support and for encouraging the staff of LBG during the development of scientific projects. This work is part of the project “Descripción de especies de Campylocentrum (Orchidaceae) en Costa Rica,” 814–A4–074 of the Vicerrectoría de Investigación, University of Costa Rica.
